title: 103_s1684
content: The Act titled "Environmental Protection Encouragement Act of 1993" allows for the election to expense certain environmental improvement property under section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of environmental improvement property as an expense, deductible in the year it is placed in service. Environmental improvement property is tangible property used in a trade or business for purposes like source reduction and solid waste minimization. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of environmental improvement property as an expense, deductible in the year it is placed in service. This property includes activities such as solid waste minimization, waste conversion or recycling, reduction of environmental hazards, compliance with permits, prevention of unplanned releases, and the manufacture and sale of alternate fuels in the United States. For tax purposes, environmental improvement property can be treated as an expense in the year it is placed in service. Definitions for terms like source reduction and solid waste minimization are provided in this subsection. The term 'waste conversion or recycling' refers to processing waste into usable products, while 'abatement of environmental hazards' involves reducing human exposure to toxic chemicals. The curr_chunk discusses potential human exposure to toxic chemicals, hazardous substances, or harmful radiation, defining terms like unplanned releases, regulated substances, and releases. The curr_chunk discusses spilling, leaking, pouring, discharging, escaping, dumping, or disposing into the environment, including the abandonment or discarding of barrels or other closed receptacles. Definitions and special rules are provided for terms like purchase, cost, and coordination with other provisions. The table of sections for part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by adding a new item after section 179A. Section 179B allows for the election to expense certain environmental improvement property. The amendments apply to property placed in service after December 31, 1993.
